subject: Sales
title: P.T. Barnum: The Greatest Showman
description: A short lesson to help you apply P.T. Barnum: The Greatest Showman.

hook.text: Barnum reportedly said 'a sucker is born every minute.' He probably never said it, but the myth sold.

buildup.text: He turned curiosities into spectacles and understood that attention is always the first sale.

discovery.text: His genius was publicity. He created controversies, planted stories in newspapers, and filled seats.

twist.text: Barnum was also a philanthropist and politician. The showman persona was itself a performance.

climax.text: He proved that spectacle, narrative, and bold promotion can build an empire from absolutely nothing.

punchline.text: He sold the show before anyone saw the act.

quiz.question: What was P.T. Barnum's real genius?
